standard_metadata.standard_description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

hints.content: $14 \times 362$ and $1.4 \times 362$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $14 \times 362$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $1.4 \times 362$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $1.4 \times 362$.  $\begin{align} 1.4 \times 362 &\approx 1\times 400\\\\ &\approx 400 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $5{,}068$ to get a product close to $400$?

$759 \times28$ and $759 \times 2.8$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $759\times 28$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $759 \times 2.8$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $759 \times 2.8$.  $\begin{align} 759 \times 2.8 &\approx 700\times 3\\\\ &\approx 2{,}100 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $21{,}252$ to get a product close to $2{,}100$?

$516 \times42$ and $516 \times 4.2$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $516\times 42$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $516 \times 4.2$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $516 \times 4.2$.  $\begin{align} 516 \times 4.2 &\approx 500\times 4\\\\ &\approx 2{,}000 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $21{,}672$ to get a product close to $2{,}000$?

$19 \times85$ and $19 \times 0.85$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $19\times 85$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $19 \times 0.85$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $19 \times 0.85$.  $\begin{align} 19 \times 0.85 &\approx 20\times 1\\\\ &\approx 20 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $1{,}615$ to get a product close to $20$?

$8{,}135 \times48$ and $81.35\times48$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $8{,}135\times 48$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $81.35 \times 48$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $81.35 \times48$.  $\begin{align} 81.35 \times 48 &\approx 80\times 50\\\\ &\approx4{,}000 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $390{,}480$ to get a product close to $4{,}000$?

$622 \times37$ and $6.22 \times 37$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $622\times 37$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $6.22 \times 37$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $6.22 \times 37$.  $\begin{align} 6.22 \times 37 &\approx 6\times 40\\\\ &\approx240 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $23{,}014$ to get a product close to $240$?

$6{,}409 \times52$ and $64.09\times52$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $6{,}409\times 52$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $64.09 \times 52$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $64.09 \times52$.  $\begin{align} 64.09 \times 52 &\approx 60\times 50\\\\ &\approx3{,}000 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $333{,}268$ to get a product close to $3{,}000$?

$94 \times812$ and $94 \times 8.12$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $94\times 812$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $94 \times 8.12$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $94 \times8.12$.  $\begin{align} 94 \times 8.12 &\approx 90\times 8\\\\ &\approx720 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $76{,}328$ to get a product close to $720$?

$8 \times2{,}405$ and $8\times24.05$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $8\times 2{,}405$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $8 \times 24.05$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $8 \times 24.05$.  $\begin{align} 8 \times 24.05 &\approx 8\times 25\\\\ &\approx200 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $19{,}240$ to get a product close to $200$?

$19 \times7$ and $0.19\times7$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $19\times 7$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $0.19 \times 7$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $0.19 \times 7$.  $\begin{align} 0.19 \times 7 &\approx 0.2\times 7\\\\ &\approx1.4 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $133$ to get a product close to $1.4$?

$592 \times3$ and $5.92\times3$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $592\times 3$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $5.92 \times 3$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $5.92 \times 3$.  $\begin{align} 5.92 \times 3 &\approx 6\times 3\\\\ &\approx18 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $1{,}776$ to get a product close to $18$?

$7{,}613 \times4$ and $76.13\times4$ multiply the same digits in the same order.    So, the product of both problems will also have the same digits in the same order.   Let's multiply $7{,}613\times 4$.  Then we can estimate to place the decimal point in the product of $76.13 \times 4$.

Let's estimate to place the decimal in $76.13 \times4$.  $\begin{align} 76.13 \times 4 &\approx 80\times 4\\\\ &\approx320 \end{align}$  Where can we place the decimal in $30{,}452$ to get a product close to $320$?
